posts.title: Automation Pyramid and the Unified Namespace | Unified Namespace (UNS) Basics 1
posts.content: In this first part of the UNS Basics mini series, we introduce the Automation Pyramid as a system to control the plant. We highlight the challenges related to data analytics and present the Unified Namespace as the solution. We also show how the Automation Pyramid connects to the Unified Namespace, according to the United Manufacturing Hub's philosophy. Finally, we briefly discuss where historical data from the Unified Namespace is saved. ➡️ If you are interested in learning more about the Automation Pyramid and the Unified Namespace, visit our website: https://www.umh.app/ ➡️ Watch the full playlist on Unified Namespace: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNv1tHc7GGk&list=PLeC0OzgWYQfuD9Jb2eUoSbv5Vu0xxSm0k Other Links: - Video about data flow into MQTT brokers: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q_Hb0d6DqxY - In depth article on The Foundations of the Unified Namespace in Operational Technology: https://learn.umh.app/lesson/chapter-1-the-foundations-of-unified-namespace-in-ot/ ------

posts.title: 5 Components of Unified Namespace (UNS)
posts.content: In this video, we break down the concept of a hashtag Unified Namespace (UNS) and explore the different ways you can connect components within your architecture. We also dive into the key components that define a #unifiednamespace: 🔹 Event-Driven Architecture: How producers, brokers, and consumers interact in real-time 🔹 Standardized Topic Hierarchy: The importance of a structured format for data organization 🔹 Message Broker: Why sending all data to the broker can be beneficial, even if it feels redundant 🔹 Stream Processing or Data Contextualization: How to ensure your data is in the right format and context 🔹 Protocol Converters: Bridging the gap between incompatible data sources and your message broker 👉 Whether you're in IT or OT, understanding these components can help you scale your system efficiently. To dive deeper and learn more about hashtag UNS, check out our blog series: https://learn.umh.app/lesson/chapter-1-the-foundations-of-unified-namespace-in-ot/ 👉 Additiona
posts.author: United Manufacturing Hub

posts.title: What is Unified Namespace (UNS) and Why Does it Matter? | UNS Essentials Part 1
posts.content: Welcome to the first part of our Unified Namespace (UNS) Essentials series, a practical guide designed for IIoT Solution Architects and Digital Transformation Specialists in manufacturing to utilize this highly efficient architectural approach. In this series, you will learn what the Unified Namespace is and why it matters, how it works and how to implement it using MQTT and Sparkplug. In this part 1, we will cover: Disadvantages of Traditional Industrial Architecture Introduction to Unified Namespace Benefits of Unified Namespace Unified Namespace (UNS) is a novel solution that allows you to collect data from various industrial IoT (IIoT) systems, add context to it, and transform it into a format that other systems can understand. Time Stamps: 0:00 Introducing UNS Essentials Series 01:00 What is Unified Namespace (UNS)? 01:18 Disadvantages of Traditional Industrial Architecture 04:51 Introducing the Unified Namespace 07:51 What are the Benefits of the Unified Namespace? Resources:
posts.author: HiveMQ

posts.title: Demo: Applying a Unified Namespace
posts.content: A unified namespace (UNS) can improve your system’s data accessibility, cost efficiency, traceability, scalability, decision-making, and more. In this demonstration, CTO of Cirrus Link Solutions Arlen Nipper explains how to build and apply a UNS without coding into cloud applications by leveraging Ignition UDTs, MQTT, and Sparkplug. DEMO HIGHLIGHTS - Ignition gateway - Ignition designer - Devices - Ignition Edge and UDTs - UNS - Smart Factory - Snowflake (SQL platform in the cloud) #Snowflake #SQL #MQTT #UDT #Sparkplug #UnifiedNameSpace #UNS -------------------------------------------------- FREE DOWNLOADS: ❇️ Ignition Maker Edition for hobbyists, students, home automation, and more: https://bit.ly/free-maker ✳️ Ignition (Full Version) for SCADA, MES, HMI, IIoT, Enterprise and more: https://bit.ly/free-ignition ✴️ Ignition Exchange - Free Ignition projects and templates: https://bit.ly/free-exchange -------------------------------------------------- 🛑 FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA!
posts.author: Inductive Automation

posts.title: What is a unified namespace?
posts.content: Understanding Industrial Unified Namespace: The Future of Data Integration Discover how a unified namespace revolutionizes industrial operations by creating a single source of truth for all your data. Learn why leading manufacturers are adopting this game-changing approach to data management and AI implementation. In this comprehensive guide, we cover: • What is a Unified Namespace? • Key benefits and applications in industrial AI • Real-world implementation • AI integration and scalability • Best practices and tips You'll learn about: • Data integration and contextualization • AI-powered insights and automation • Predictive maintenance capabilities • Real-time monitoring and analytics • Scalable industrial solutions • Connected worker empowerment This video provides essential insights for process engineers, data scientists, and operations managers looking to leverage unified namespace technology for industrial automation and industrial AI applications. Additional resource
posts.author: SymphonyAI

posts.title: How a Unified Namespace (UNS) Works: Live Demo
posts.content: See a live Unified Namespace (UNS) in action from Hannover Messe 2025. We show how real-time data flows from the edge to the cloud. In this live demonstration, we give a tour of a Unified Namespace (UNS) built specifically for the event. This demo features Tulip integrated with: • HighByte for data aggregation and normalization. • HiveMQ as the MQTT broker. • Snowflake as the cloud data historian. The ultimate goal of this architecture is to create a simple, human-readable data schema. This allows you to access information across all systems in real-time and build new applications faster than ever. posts.title: Demystifying Unified Namespace - Part 1: Intro
posts.content: This conversation delves into the concept of Unified Namespace (UNS), exploring its significance in data integration and access within industrial settings. The speakers discuss the challenges and misconceptions surrounding UNS, emphasizing its role in providing centralized access to contextualized data. They highlight the importance of starting small while keeping a broader vision in mind for successful implementation. The discussion also touches on the relationship between UNS and existing systems, as well as the need for effective data modeling and naming conventions. More at https://analyticsforindustry.com/ Chapters 00:00 Understanding the Concept of UNS 02:05 The Role of Data in UNS 05:09 Challenges and Misconceptions of UNS 08:07 Implementing UNS in Existing Systems 11:11 Final Thoughts and Next Steps
posts.author: Analytics for Industry

posts.title: What is a Unified Namespace and how to build one | ISEE 2023
posts.content: Turning abstract, complex concepts into practical, actionable information is our favourite thing. This is our way of building a Unified Namespace using Ignition and MQTT. Mathias will present to you what a UNS is, why it is useful, and how we go about building one. Access the slides: https://enuda.eu/what-is-a-unified-namespace-and-how-to-build-one/ 00:00 Agenda 00:37 Current problems 03:53 The solution 06:36 What is MQTT? 12:32 Infrastructure 14:24 Structure of the UNS 19:48 Location of the UNS 22:13 Data in the UNS 25:12 Benefits of UNS 26:10 How to build a UNS in Ignition 30:57 Demo 44:23 Take-home messages Join the discussions on our new Discord server for the European community of Ignition enthusiasts: https://discord.gg/n7AAzxtKkV

posts.title: Add Historical Data Access and Data Transformation to the Unified Namespace (UNS)
posts.content: An overview of how a Unified Analytics Framework architecture, or UAF, provides historical data access and transfer, as well as a centrally governed data transformation process to the unified namespace.
posts.author: Flow Software

posts.title: What is Event-Driven Architecture and MQTT | Unified Namespace (UNS) Basics 2
posts.content: In this second part of the UNS basics video series, we explain the key concepts behind Event-Driven Architecture (EDA), including the role of the MQTT protocol and MQTT brokers. Both Event-Driven architecture and MQTT are main components of the Unified Namespace. If you want to learn more about the Unified Namespace, you can read this article: https://learn.umh.app/course/the-unified-namespace-as-the-strongest-architectural-proposal-for-industry-4-0/ ➡️ If you are interested in seeing how we use event-driven architecture and MQTT brokers as the foundation of our product, visit our website: https://www.umh.app/. 👇 Other Links: - Chapter 2: The Rise of the Unified Namespace: https://learn.umh.app/lesson/chapter-2-the-rise-of-the-unified-namespace/ - Chapter 3: The Foundations of the Unified Namespace in Information Technology: https://learn.umh.app/lesson/chapter-3-the-foundations-of-the-unified-namespace-in-information-technology/ - LinkedIn Kafka: https://engineering.linkedin.com/t
posts.author: United Manufacturing Hub

posts.title: Data Management Problems and the Unified Namespace Solution
posts.content: Time-consuming and error-prone manual data entry and point-to-point data integration have led to problems with managing data efficiently. Director of Sales Engineering at Inductive Automation Kent Melville and President and CTO of Cirrus Link Solutions Arlen Nipper discuss how a unified namespace is cost-effective, scalable, standardizes data, provides a single source of truth, and much more. DATA MANAGEMENT PROBLEMS 🟠 Manual data entry: - Time-consuming - Error-prone 🟠 Point-to-point data integration: - Needs specialized engineering - Has tightly coupled namespaces - Low scalability UNIFIED NAMESPACE BENEFITS - Improves data accessibility - Cost-effective - Better prediction capabilities - Better traceability - Easier scalability - Provides a single source of truth - Requires less work - Better supply chain utilization - Greater efficiency - Better decision-making UNIFIED NAMESPACE ARCHITECTURE TIPS - Model the architecture based on your environment, facility, and processes. -
posts.author: Inductive Automation

posts.title: What is a UNS (Unified Namespace) | #AugmentedOps #Podcast
posts.author: Tulip

posts.title: Unified Namespace in Smart Manufacturing - HiveMQ Demo
posts.content: The Unified Namespace (UNS) brings together all the data from across organizations, contextualizes it into business information, generates actionable insights, and maintains data integrity. In this demo, Magnus McCune will showcase how a smart car manufacturer leverages UNS to digitize their plants that use protocols like OPC UA and Modbus to connect equipment and how the manufacturer used UNS to standardize data flow across multiple sites. Watch as data moves from producers through HiveMQ Edge, into a centralized cloud broker, and is published to a data lake or other destinations for further use. In the second half of the demo, you’ll be introduced to the UNS topic structure, which reflects the organization’s structure. See it in action with the UNS Explore, an ISO 95 style representation of a Unified Namespace. Finally, discover the UNS Bot, an AI-powered tool that allows you to query the Unified Namespace interactively and get a chatbot response. Time Stamps: 0:00 Introduction 0:
posts.author: HiveMQ

posts.title: The Unified Namespace (UNS) explained - Design and Model your Operational Data Platform
posts.content: 🚀 Want to learn more about Industrial DataOps/UNS and how to make digital transformation a success? We have just launched our ITOT.Academy, find all info here: https://itot.academy 🚀 In this conversation, David discusses the concept of the Unified Namespace (UNS), emphasizing its role as a design pattern for organizing data within an operational data platform. He highlights the challenges posed by data silos, the importance of contextualizing data, and the need for real-time access to information. David also explores various data storage solutions and architectures, advocating for a hybrid approach that combines traditional and modern technologies. He concludes by stressing the importance of agility and a use-case-driven mindset in data management. Takeaways The Unified Namespace (UNS) is an aspirational concept. Data silos hinder effective predictive maintenance. Fast and secure access to data is crucial for organizations. UNS helps organize data into a centralized broker. Contextu
posts.author: The IT OT Insider

posts.title: Applications of Unified Namespace in Manufacturing
posts.content: Discover how the Unified Namespace (UNS) is revolutionizing manufacturing in the era of Industry 4.0. In this video, Kudzai Manditereza breaks down the six key applications of UNS that are transforming factories worldwide: - Optimizing Asset Utilization - Quality Assurance and Monitoring - Regulatory Compliance - Production Scheduling - Logistics - AI Readiness These are the main use cases in Unified Namespace for Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0. posts.title: Unified Namespace by Ricardo Santos - More Than Just a Buzzword! #uns #iiot #smartfactory
posts.content: “A UNS is the real-time Single Source of Truth (SSOT) for all your industrial data.” A Unified Namespace (UNS) isn’t just another industry buzzword—it’s the backbone of smart manufacturing. It’s a unified data model that structures and contextualizes information across all levels of your operation, eliminating silos and ensuring seamless IT-OT convergence. Think of it as: ✅ The hub where all your smart things communicate ✅ The foundation for scalable, vendor-agnostic architecture ✅ The key to real-time insights and automated decision-making Still relying on outdated point-to-point integrations? It’s time to change the game! 🔥 Ricardo Santos Industry 4.0 facilitator 🤖 Digital bricklayer 💎 Speaker 🎤 🇺🇸 Tupinix - Smart Factory Solutions 🌐 https://tupinix.com
posts.author: Tupinix - Smart Factory Solutions

posts.title: Is the Unified Namespace a buzzword? And why you SHOULD implement UNS in your factory. #UNS #IIoT
posts.content: Is your factory truly connected, or are you still dealing with isolated systems and fragmented data? If you’re making decisions based on inconsistent data, it’s time to discover UNS – The Unified Namespace. 🚀 What is UNS, and Why Does Your Factory Need It? UNS is more than a data architecture—it’s the digital backbone of your operations. It eliminates data silos, organizes information in real time, and ensures all systems communicate in a structured, seamless way. 🔹 Key Problems UNS Solves: ❌ Data locked in legacy systems that don’t communicate ❌ High costs with custom integrations and endless rework ❌ Misaligned information between production, maintenance, and logistics ❌ Lack of scalability for new technologies and factory expansions 🔹 Why is UNS the Solution? ✅ A Single Source of Truth – Standardizes and structures data in a unified model, accessible across the enterprise ✅ Total Connectivity – Seamlessly integrates sensors, PLCs, SCADA, MES, and ERP in real time ✅ Foundation fo
posts.author: Tupinix - Smart Factory Solutions

posts.title: Unified Namespace and Cloud-to-Edge: New Use Cases for ​Industrial DataOps
posts.content: In this 45-minute webinar, HighByte Chief Business Office John Harrington and Chief Technology Officer Aron Semle introduce you to HighByte Intelligence Hub version 1.4 and provide a demonstration of new features and their use cases. You'll see how to push SQL data to a Unified Namespace, process multiple rows of data from SQL queries, leverage MQTT inputs and OPC outputs to efficiently move data from Cloud to Edge, and work with OPC UA arrays and CSV files. By watching this webinar, you will: - Understand the advantage of using an Industrial DataOps solution for data standardization and system integration - Learn how to work with SQL inputs and outputs - Learn how to move data from AWS IoT Core to an OPC server for Cloud-to-Edge use cases - See how to leverage the new CSV file connector to deliver data from legacy industrial devices and systems to an MQTT broker and SQL database
posts.author: HighByte

posts.title: #UNSwithGrantek: Choosing the Right Tech for Unified Namespace Success
posts.content: #UNSwithGrantek Offers Insight to Help Your Operations. “Convergence of IT/OT and Unified Namespace (UNS) with Grantek: Pharma and Food & Beverage MES Applications Using Data Brokers” is your chance to hear from Jim Toman, Smart MES Engineer at Grantek and Bryon Hayes, Life Sciences Engineer and Consultant at Grantek. Grantek has over 30 years of experience and expertise designing, implementing, and supporting Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) that address manufacturer’s specific needs, vision, and processes. Rather than purchasing a rigid platform that forces you to change your process to fit the needs of the software, Grantek understands an MES must be designed to work with your existing business and manufacturing systems in order to be successful. MES can help maximize performance, increase productivity, reduce waste, ensure product quality, and increase efficiency in manufacturing operations. Today, MES implementation is necessary to remain competitive and meet regulatory re
posts.author: Grantek

posts.title: Trends Shaping Enterprise Deployments in Manufacturing: Unified Namespace, DataOps, and the Edge
posts.content: In this broadcast, Torey Penrod-Cambra moderates an interactive panel discussion between Chief Product Officer John Harrington and Chief Technology Officer Aron Semle. The team discusses key trends that are shifting the way industrial companies think about their system architectures and data governance. This broadcast includes quick demos of new features in HighByte Intelligence Hub version 3.0 and a Q&A. Chapters: Introduction 0:00 What is Industrial DataOps? 8:36 What does data contextualization mean? 11:10 How would you define UNS and how can it be achieved? 22:18 Why is a UNS attractive to many manufacturers? 25:16 What is the blind spot for UNS? 26:02 How do you structure a UNS? 30:16 How have architectural patterns changed in the last 12 months and where are they going? 35:15 What are data pipelines, and how can they accelerate my projects? 44:52 Q&A 48:24
posts.author: HighByte

posts.title: MQTT, the silent power behind Unified Namespace
posts.content: MQTT is the backbone of a Unified Namespace (UNS), enabling real-time data flow across industrial environments. But why is it the ideal protocol to connect OT & IT? In this video, Adrien Bousez & Mathias Knop break down: 1️⃣ What is Unified Namespace? Discover how UNS replaces the traditional automation pyramid with a modern, scalable architecture that bridges the gap between IT and OT. 2️⃣ Why does it matter? Learn how UNS streamlines operations, supports real-time decision-making, and lays the groundwork for cost savings and innovative technologies like AI and digital twins. 3️⃣ How to get started with UNS. We outline practical steps to help you implement UNS in your organisation, ensuring it becomes the backbone of your smart factory. Chapters: 00:00 Introduction 00:30 What is MQTT and how does it work? 01:45 Why is MQTT the ideal candidate for OT & IT integration? 03:20 How does Sparkplug enhance MQTT for industrial applications? 05:10 Conclusion Want to learn more? Connect
posts.author: Coretecs

posts.title: Monitoring Chemical Plant Tanks with Unified Namespace
posts.content: Dave sets up a pilot solution for a company with multiple chemical plants to remotely monitor tank status. Situation: * Multiple chemical plants * Monitor multiple tanks with a simple SCADA at a single corporate location * Also view data in a dashboard How the solution works: * Edge node publishes to the Unified Namespace using a MQTT broker * Data organized into a Unified Namespace * SCADA (Ignition) subscribes as a node to the Unified Namespace to display the data * Historian subscribes as a node to the Unified Namespace to historize the data This solution, like our other videos, uses open technologies, and principles to enable flexible and scalable solutions for the future. These kinds of solutions can be created by applying the following principles: * Report by exception * Edge driven * Lightweight * Open technologies Chapters ------------------------------------------- 0:00- Intro 0:20- Thoughts on the recent launch event 1:20- Monitoring Chemical Plant Tanks
posts.author: Ectobox, Inc.

posts.title: Local data processing. Edge flows. Unified Namespace.
posts.content: Fuuz is pushing beyond the cloud—and if you’re still relying on outdated, rigid systems, this episode is your wake-up call. In this episode of The Manufacturing Matrix, Craig Scott and Lance Menard break down how Fuuz is giving manufacturers the tools to handle data in real time, even during outages. Plus, get a first look at the upcoming Fuuz Unified Namespace (UNS)—your new single source of truth for enterprise data. 🎧 Listen: https://loom.ly/-r5_95w 📺 Watch: https://loom.ly/XiBTmHk #Manufacturing #MES #Fuuz #EdgeComputing #UnifiedNamespace #DigitalTransformation

posts.title: supOS Casebook | Smart City Powered by Unified Namespace
posts.content: Discover how supOS transforms smart city project in three steps: Step1: Edge Data Integration & System Connectivity Seamlessly aggregate and connect data from diverse edge devices and systems for real-time interoperability. Step2: Contextualized Data Modeling Standardize and structure data using ISA-95 frameworks to enable actionable insights and predictive analytics. Step3: Practical Applications for Operations Build unlimited apps to monitor, control, and optimize building functions, enhancing productivity and sustainability. Learn how supOS bridges data, systems, and intelligence to revolutionize urban living. Watch now! #supOS #SmartCity#iiot #UnifiedNamespace#digitaltransformation #IndustrialIoT #EdgeComputing #DataIntegration #DataModeling #DigitalTransformation #IIoTPlatform #SmartInfrastructure #UrbanInnovation #IoTApplications #RealTimeData #PredictiveAnalytics #SmartOperations #SustainableCities #Industry40 #IIoTSolutions #DataInteroperability #FREEZONEX

posts.title: Unlocking the Power of Unified Namespace
posts.content: Unlock the true potential of your industrial data with our latest video, "Unlocking the Power of Unified Namespace in Industrial Data Management"! Today, we explore how a Unified Namespace (UNS) revolutionizes data management by breaking down silos and creating a single source of truth for your operations. Discover how a UNS enhances decision-making across departments—from maintenance to finance—by providing real-time access to accurate data. Learn the key principles of implementing a UNS to optimize resource allocation and boost predictive capabilities. Despite the challenges, the benefits of a connected industrial future are immense! If you found this video insightful, please give it a thumbs up and share it with your colleagues! #UnifiedNamespace #DataManagement #IndustrialInnovation #SmartManufacturing #DigitalTransformation OUTLINE: 00:00:00 Introduction to Unified Namespace (UNS) 00:00:35 The Power of UNS 00:00:57 Key Principles of UNS 00:01:22 Integrating Work Execution
posts.author: MicroMain

posts.title: Unified Namespace (UNS): An Architecture for Commercial Building Data!
posts.content: Brahm Lategan, Smart Building Consultant at MiX, talks about how the Unified Namespace (UNS) architecture could be used as a 'single source of truth' for building data. UNS can create a centralized, non-hierarchical structure for real-time data exchange across IT and OT systems. Listen to the Full Podcast Episode Here 👉👉 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8VrxN265rVU
posts.author: Smart Building Series

posts.title: How to transform operations with Unified Namespace (UNS): a Real-life use case
posts.content: With this video, we dive into a real-life use case showcasing the power of Unified Namespace (UNS). Discover how it helped to overcome challenges like data silos, real-time monitoring gaps, and inefficient anomaly detection 💡 Why Watch This Video? - Practical steps to prepare for and implement UNS. - Insights into the value UNS can bring to your organisation. - A real-life use case of UNS 1️⃣ Challenges Addressed: - Lack of a complete production overview. - Manual, time-consuming anomaly detection. - Isolated systems and data silos. 2️⃣ Approach: Implementation of a Unified Namespace to centralize and structure data, enabling: - Real-time anomaly detection using AI-driven vision systems. - Improved operational insights with SCADA (Ignition) and a Historian (Canary). - Scalable, future-ready architecture with MQTT as the backbone. 3️⃣ Key Results: - Reduced waste through efficient anomaly detection. - Eliminated data silos for seamless integration. - Laid a scalable foundation for
posts.author: Coretecs
